King Ethelbert School is a mixed secondary school located in Birchington-on-Sea, Kent, England. A wide variety of subjects are available at GCSE level as well as IB or BTEC in sixth form.
Facilities
The school was one of the last to benefit from the Building Schools for the Future programme. As of June 2025, the school has a number of buildings coded via letters; B, M, R, G, W. As well as a sports hall and a number of portable buildings. In addition, the school is one of many in the country to be affected by RAAC.
